snippet.title: COINCIDENCE? OR TURNBULL'S SECRET DEAL TO TAKE GUANTANAMO PRISONERS?
snippet.content:
Did Malcolm Turnbull secretly agree to take the last 31 prisoners at Guantanamo Bay - men long suspected of terrorism - if the US took our boat people in exchange?
Does that explain a mysterious reference to "31" in ? Or is this all just a strange coincidence?
I, like everyone else, thought "31" was a of a reference to the "refugees" Turnbull had agreed to take from Costa Rica in exchange in a deal he made with then president Barack Obama:
TURNBULL: . I say this to you sincerely that it is in the mutual interest of the United States to say, "yes, we can conform with that deal - we are not obliged to take anybody we do not want, we will go through extreme vetting" and that way you are seen to show the respect that a trusted ally wants and deserves. We will then hold up our end of the bargain by taking in our country 31 [inaudible] that you need to move on from... Basically, we are taking people from the previous administration that they were very keen on getting out of the United States. We will take more. We will take anyone that you want us to take. The only people that we do not take are people who come by boat. So we would rather take a not very attractive guy that helps you out than to take a Noble [sic] Peace Prize winner that comes by boat. As I said, I first took this to be a transcription error. I also assumed Turnbull misspoke in referred to the Costa Rican refugees as people that the Obama administration was "very keen on getting out of the United States", when they are in fact in Costa Rica.
But two errors in one White House transcript in a short reference to this deal?
What if they are not errors at all?
So who are the 31? These "not very attractive" people?
There are indeed 31 unattractive people that Obama - and now Trump - are very keen keen to get out of the US.
Of the roughly 780 people who have been detained at the United States military prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, . Wait, that's 41, not 31, you will say.
But of those 41, 10 are clearly people we could never ever accept, as they've been convicted of terrorism offences or been charged:
7 Charged in Military Commissions System... 3 Convicted in Military Commissions System That leaves these 31, including Bali bomber :
5 Held in Law-of-War Detention but Recommended for Transfer if Security Conditions Met. Barhoumi, Sufyian ... Algeria Nasir, Abdul Latif ... Moroccoal Yazidi, Ridah Bin Saleh ... Tunisia al Bihani, Tolfiq Nassar Ahmed ... Yemen Abd al Sattar, Muieen A Deen Jamal A Deen Abd al Fusal ... Unknown National Origin 26 Held in Indefinite Law-of-War Detention and not Recommended for Transfer al Afghani, Muhammad Rahim ... Afghanistan al Afghani, Haroon ... Afghanistan Abdelrahman, Abdelrazak Ali ... Algeria Hambali (Riduan Isamuddin) ... Indonesia Malik, Abdul ... Kenya al Libi, Abu Faraj ... Libya al Bakush, Ismael Ali Farag ... Libya Zubair (Mohd Farik Bin Amin) ... Malaysia Lillie (Mohammed Nazir Bin Lep) ... Malaysia Rabbani, Mohammed Ahmad Ghulam ... Pakistan Paracha, Saifullah ... Pakistan Abu Rahman, Abdul Rabbani Abd al Rahim ... Pakistan , Abu ... Palestinian Territories al Qahtani, Mohammed ... Saudi Arabia al Sharbi, Ghassan Abdullah ... Saudi Arabia Dourad, Gouled Hassan ... Somalia Sharqawi, Abdu Ali al Haji ... Yemen al Hilal, Abdul al Salam ... Yemen Bin Attash, Hassan Mohammed Ali ... Yemen al Kazimi, Sanad Yislam ... Yemen al Rammah, Omar Mohammed Ali ... Yemen Nashir, Said Salih Said ... Yemen al Sharabi, Zuhail Abdo Anam Said ... Yemen Qasim, Khaled ... Yemen al Alwi, Moath Hamza Ahmed ... Yemen Uthman, Uthman Abdul Rahim Mohammed ... Yemen I find it very hard to believe that Turnbull would have agreed to take in such people. The political and security risks would just be too high. There is no way Australians would accept it -it they knew.
So I am strongly inclined to believe this is a coincidence.
Yet I'd still like the government to explain who else could be the "31" - the "not very attractive" people that the Obama administration was "very keen on getting out of the United States"?
PS: I have asked the Immigration Minister for an answer and will let you know if he responds.
(Thanks to reader Jim.)

sindex.name: Muieen A Deen Jamal A Deen Abd
